lines.gurmukhi: brKw sMjog mukqwhl Erw pRgws praupkwr Aau ibkwrI qau khwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Barakhaa Sanjog Moukataahal Aoraa Pragaasa , Paraoupakaar Au Bikaaree Tau Kahaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the rainy season, both pearl and hailstones are produced. Being of the same form, a pearl is considered good doer while the hailstone causes damage.

lines.gurmukhi: Erw brKq jYsy Dwn pws ko ibnwsu mukqw AnUp rUp sBw soBw pwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Aoraa Barakhat Jaisay Dhaan Paas Ko Binaasu , Moukataa Anoop Roop Sabhaa Sobhaa Paavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Hailstones destroy/damage crops and other vegetation, whereas a pearl is praised for its beauty and lustrous form.

lines.gurmukhi: Erw qau ibkwr Dwir dyKq iblwie jwie praupkwr mukqw ijau TihrwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Aoraa Tau Bikaar Dhaari Daykhat Bilaai Jaai , Paraoupakaar Moukataa Jiu Tthahiraavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Being damaging in nature, a hailstone melts away in no time, whereas a good doer pearl remains stable.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI AswD swD sMgiq suBwv giq gurmiq durmiq durY n durwveI ]163]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Hee Asaadh Saadh Sangati Soubhaav Gati , Gurmati Duramati Durai N Duraavaee ?163?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similar is the effect of the company of vice/evil and virtuous people. The supreme wisdom acquired by the teachings of a True Guru and polluted intellect due to base wisdom cannot be hidden. (163)
